name: Beeswax
description: Natural wax produced by honeybees. Used as a primary base material for wax filament composites with good layer adhesion and moderate hardness.

name: Pine Rosin
description: Natural pine resin that melts into a tacky film and chemically bonds layers. Provides strong adhesion, hardness, and tack. Essential for filament structural integrity.

name: Carnauba Wax
description: High-hardness plant wax used to significantly increase surface polish and rigidity in mold materials. Clean-burning and widely accessible.

name: Soy Wax
description: Plant-based wax with moderate anti-shrink properties. Reduces mold warping and shrinkage. Hydrogenated soy oil wax that gently increases viscosity in blends.

name: Coconut Wax
description: Soft, slow-shrinking wax derived from coconut oil. Provides dimensional control and gentle thickening in soft or brittle wax systems.

name: Soy Lecithin
description: Plant-derived phospholipid emulsifier that enhances molecular dispersion and wetting. Improves layer cohesion and miscibility in composite waxes.

name: Cork Flour
description: Lightweight, compressible biomass filler from ground cork bark. Enhances shock absorption, reduces hardness, and acts as a thermal insulator. Very low density (~0.2 g/cm3).

name: Grog (1 um)
description: Ultra-fine pre-fired ceramic particles. Strong effect on viscosity, hardness, and shrinkage at low volume fraction. Best for ultra-stable micro-detail wax molds.

name: Grog (3 um)
description: Very fine calcined clay particles. Contributes to dimensional stability and reduces shrinkage while allowing smoother flow than coarse grog.

name: Grog (6 um)
description: Moderately fine pre-fired ceramic powder. Balances structural rigidity and flow resistance. Easily made from crushed and sieved fired clay or brick.

name: Kaolinite Clay
description: Naturally occurring clay with fine platelets. Increases hardness and flexural modulus when mixed into wax composites. Readily available from decomposed granite.

name: Calcium Bentonite Clay
description: Abundant swelling clay from volcanic ash deposits. Provides thixotropy, suspension stability, shock absorption, and shrinkage reduction in wax blends.

name: Calcium Alginate
description: Ionic gel derived from brown seaweed. Contributes to solidification rate, surface hardness, and shock absorption when used as dry powder filler.

name: Graphite Powder
description: Highly conductive carbon additive that significantly improves heat distribution in wax composites. Enables faster and more uniform melting and solidification.

name: Diatomaceous Earth
description: Amorphous silica shells of fossil diatoms. High porosity and surface area increase viscosity significantly at moderate filler loadings.

name: Attapulgite Clay
description: Naturally fibrous clay from sedimentary deposits. Adds thixotropy to wax systems and helps stabilize particulate dispersions. Requires only drying and sieving.

name: Stearin
description: Waxy fatty acid derived from animal or plant sources. Helps limit shrinkage and maintain flow control and blend uniformity.

name: Glass Microfibers
description: Short strands of high-modulus glass fiber that strongly increase flexural stiffness but reduce shock absorption. Must be well dispersed to prevent clogging.

name: Silica Flour
description: Extremely fine inert powder used as a flow modifier and anti-stick agent. Reduces tack and melt cohesion.

name: Chalk Powder
description: Finely ground calcium carbonate filler. Disrupts wax flow and reduces bonding between layers, useful for anti-adhesion control or sacrificial layers.

name: Illite Clay
description: Naturally abundant red/yellow clay offering moderate stiffness reinforcement. Easily processed into powder after sun-drying. Often found in riverbanks and temperate soils.

name: Copaiba Balsam
description: Naturally soft, viscous oleoresin that adds significant impact resistance and elasticity. Plasticizes wax blends for increased durability.

name: Frankincense
description: Aromatic resin with woody citrus aroma. Adds moderate resilience, elasticity, and soft stickiness to wax composites.

name: Myrrh Oleoresin
description: Sticky aromatic oleoresin that improves wax adhesion, toughness, and crack resistance. Provides both tack and lasting bond after solidification.

name: Ginger Oleoresin
description: Warm, spicy additive that provides moderate tackiness, softening, and elasticity. Supports smooth melt contact during extrusion.

name: Benzoin Resin Extract
description: Aromatic resin extract from Styrax trees. Enhances tack and interlayer bonding in wax blends. Adds warm, sweet vanilla-like aroma.

name: Copal Resin
description: Semi-hard aromatic resin that improves surface bonding strength, hardness, gloss, and durability. Often used in varnishes and rigid waxes.

name: Carrageenan Resin
description: Seaweed-derived biopolymer with gelling and wetting properties. Boosts layer adhesion and tack by improving melt-phase contact and surface coverage.
